user.title: 2N IP Relay Emulator Setup
user.description: Configure the HTTP endpoints that emulate a 2N IP relay. This will create virtual relays (switches) and buttons accessible via Home Assistant's web server on a dedicated subpath (e.g., http://homeassistant.local:8123/2n-relay or http://homeassistant.local:8123/2n/door1 for nested paths).

data_description.subpath: The URL path where endpoints will be available. Supports nested paths with forward slashes (e.g., '2n/door1'). Only letters, numbers, dashes, underscores, and forward slashes allowed.
data_description.relay_count: Relays maintain state (on/off). Useful for door locks that need continuous power.
data_description.button_count: Buttons are momentary triggers with no state. Useful for door strikes or gate openers.

error.subpath_in_use: This subpath is already used by another 2N Relay Emulator instance
error.invalid_subpath: Invalid subpath. Use only letters, numbers, dashes, underscores, and forward slashes. No consecutive slashes allowed.
